description: From Middle English manfully; equivalent to manful +â€Ž -ly.

adverbs.description: manfully (comparative more manfully, superlative most manfully)

entries.meaning: In a manful manner; with the characteristics considered typical of a man, such as strength, courage, and determination.
examples: She manfully struggled on, however - womanfully would perhaps be a stronger and more appropriate word. She had to calculate not only how to play her own hand correctly, but she had to calculate on her partner's probable errors.
